page.title: 17****** PENICUIK HOUSE ******
page.content: THE RUIN>{Only the walls exist of this MANSION{which was once an elegant and {commodious residence in the Grecian {style.Designed by}Sir James Clerk{and {built by}John Baxter{between 1761 and {1769 it was destroyed by fire on 16th {June 1899.}THESTABLE>{One of the first {stables in Scotland to be converted in {to a house.Built in 1763 & one of the {finest in the country it has a three {arched portico,exuberant clocktower- {steeple,courtyard and dome shaped dove {cot(a replica of the Roman Temple of {Victory-ARTHUR'S OVEN).}The furnishing {within}"NEW"PENICUIK HOUSE{are unique. {Many items were saved from the blaze {which gutted the original mansion. {ITEMS OF INTEREST INCLUDE}MARBLE TOP- PED TABLES,COUCHES, CHAIRS AND CHEST OF DRAWERS{-ALL DESIGNED BY FAMILY'S {PERSONAL CARPENTER JAMES BLAIKIE. STATUES,CLOCKS,MIRRORS&PAINTINGS TOO.
